issue.title: [Python] default_version of a release should not include SNAPSHOT
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4385](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4385). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The 0.12 release had `default_version = '0.12.0-SNAPSHOT'` in the source thus triggering https://github.com/conda-forge/pyarrow-feedstock/issues/69. Instead, we should remove the SNAPSHOT suffix in our release scripts.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4385?focusedCommentId=16753462) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
`[~kou]` As you adapted these scripts, can you have a short look?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4385?focusedCommentId=16753632) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
OK. I'll look into this.
It's strange that https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/6fcd910aa01b1c1923779bff29f162ce40caa98d doesn't have a diff for `python/setup.py`.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4385?focusedCommentId=16753672) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 3502
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3502>
